article_node.title: Mother and son arrested at Miami airport after fatal New Jersey street racing crash and escape attempt
article_node.summary: Alvi Limani, 20, and his mother Vilma Vneshta, 42, were arrested in Miami after attempting to flee to Albania following a fatal street racing crash in New Jersey that resulted in the death of Limani's friend, Albion Hysenaj. Limani faces multiple charges including aggravated manslaughter and vehicular homicide, while Vneshta is charged with hindering apprehension. The crash occurred during a reckless street race on the Garden State Parkway, where Limani was allegedly driving at 112 mph in a 55 mph zone.
